alert.note: Alert for Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 25 at 4:00AM PDT until August 25 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING ACROSS ZONES 607 AND 660... .Poor overnight humidity recoveries and gusty east winds will continue to produce locally critical fire weather conditions this morning through the Columbia River Gorge and surrounding higher terrain. A slight chance of thunderstorms will also continue through later this morning from Mount Hood National Forest through the South Washington Cascades. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 607 AND 660... * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 607 Mt. Hood National Forest West of Cascade Crest. In Washington, Fire Weather Zone 660 Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills. * WINDS...East 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * THUNDERSTORMS...2 (A slight chance of thunderstorms). * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid fire spread which may threaten life and property. Use extra caution with potential ignition sources, especially in grassy areas. Outdoor burning is not recommended. Abundant lightning Thursday night into Friday morning may cause several new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of the above conditions can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills
